metadata.name: The House You Live In
metadata.description:
This audio-visual artwork explores the ideas related to perception and thinking process - how words we use become our thoughts and our thoughts shape how we perceive the world. Essentially, the thoughts become the house one lives in. By providing a meditative experience, the artist asks the viewers to forget about the vocabulary and open themselves to feelings. One doesnâ€™t need words to be able to feel joy or to experience calmness.

Music by Michael Askill.

The collector will receive a high-res file of this artwork.

Dimension: 1920px x 1920px
